subject: Public Speaking
title: Harvey Milk's Hope Speech
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Harvey Milk's Hope Speech.

hook.text: In 1978, Harvey Milk became one of America's first openly gay elected officials. His message was simple: hope.

buildup.text: He told LGBTQ+ youth that they were not alone and that a better future was possible through visibility.

discovery.text: Milk argued that coming out was the most powerful political act â€” because you can't hate someone you know.

twist.text: He was assassinated months later. But his recorded speeches became rallying points for decades of activism.

climax.text: Milk proved that the most personal speeches often have the most universal impact. Vulnerability is persuasive.

punchline.text: He gave hope a voice. It outlived the violence.

quiz.question: What did Harvey Milk argue was the most powerful political act?
